channel.title: CVE Feed for mcitar -- Anti-Spam: Spam Protection | Block Spam Users, Comments, Forms
channel.description: The latest CVEs for mcitar -- Anti-Spam: Spam Protection | Block Spam Users, Comments, Forms

item.title: CVE-2023-7065|2024-06-04T17:17:25.367Z -- mcitar -- anti-spam%3A%20spam%20protection%20%7C%20block%20spam%20users%2C%20comments%2C%20forms
item.description: The Stop Spammers Security | Block Spam Users, Comments, Forms plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 2024.4. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the sfs_process AJAX action. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to add arbitrary IPs to the plugin's allowlist and blocklist via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.
